title: Body of septuagenarian recovered in Ctg
body: The police recovered the body of a septuagenarian from the Ichamati River in Chattogram on Wednesday, nine days after his disappearance. Being informed by a cowboy, a team of Anwara police went to the spot and rescued the floating body of Abu Sayed, 70, a resident of Pirkhayin village under Haildhar union of the upazila. The almost decomposed body of the deceased had been floating on the river at a place near the upazila warehouse under sadar union. Abu Syed’s family sources said that he remained untraced after leaving home about nine days ago, and they could not ascertain his whereabouts after a search for the past nine days. Anwara police said that they had not yet confirmed whether the death was a killing or an accidental one. ‘The body was sent to the CMCH morgue for an autopsy.’
